title: C88-1044

sentences.text: This paper presents necessary and sufficient conditions for the use of demonstrative expressions in English and discusses implications for current discourse processing algorithms .
We examine a broad range of texts to show how the distribution of demonstrative forms and functions is genre dependent .
This research is part of a larger study of anaphoric expressions , the results of which will be incorporated into a natural language generation system .

summary: This paper presents necessary and sufficient conditions for the use of demonstrative expressions in English and discusses implications for current discourse processing algorithms . We examine a broad range of texts to show how the distribution of demonstrative forms and functions is genre dependent . This research is part of a larger study of anaphoric expressions , the results of which will be incorporated into a natural language generation system .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject provides or offers something to someone else. This can be a physical object, an idea, a solution, or any other type of offering. The presentation implies a sense of sharing or making available what was previously not accessible.

Predicate-discusses_implications_for.label: discusses implications for
Predicate-discusses_implications_for.description: The predicate 'discusses implications for' indicates that the subject (a concept or theory) explores and examines the consequences, outcomes, or effects of applying or considering the object (another concept, method, or approach). In other words, it highlights how the subject relates to or influences the object.

Predicate-examine.label: examine
Predicate-examine.description: To examine means to carefully consider or investigate the properties, characteristics, or contents of something (the object), often with a goal of gaining understanding, insight, or knowledge. The subject performs this action by applying their attention and analytical skills to the object.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates a relationship where the subject is a constituent or component of the object. It suggests that the subject has some inherent connection, belongingness, or membership to the object.

Predicate-will_be_incorporated_into.label: will be incorporated into
Predicate-will_be_incorporated_into.description: The predicate 'will be incorporated into' indicates that the subject's content or essence will be merged with or become a part of the object. This implies a process of integration, assimilation, or absorption where the subject's characteristics are absorbed by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or category of a more general concept or domain represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a subcategory or specialization within the broader scope defined by the object.
